clean_content:
Definition / general

* Also called canker sores* Affect 40% in U.S.* More common up to 20 years* Painful, recurrent and familial

Case reports

* 26 year old HIV+ man with recurrent ulcer treated with laser therapy ([Case Rep Med 2012;2012:695642](23346114))

Clinical images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityaphthouswiki01.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Aphthous_ulcer.jpg)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityaphthouswiki02.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Aphtha2.jpg)

Aphthous ulcers

  
  
26 year old man:  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityaphthousclinical1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3546470/figure/fig1/)

Minor ulcer

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityaphthousclinical2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3546470/figure/fig2/)

Major ulcer

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityaphthousclinical3.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3546470/figure/fig3/)

Laser therapy

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityaphthousclinical4.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3546470/figure/fig4/)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityaphthousclinical5.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3546470/figure/fig5/)
 
[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityaphthousclinical6.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3546470/figure/fig6/)

After one week of laser treatment

Gross description

* Single or multiple, shallow, hyperemic ulcerations covered by a thin exudate with hyperemic rim

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Initially mononuclear infiltrate, then neutrophilic infiltrate from secondary bacterial infection
